repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->
Fixes: #33483

comment_regular_data.body: You need to change mentions of the old path in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33048/files to the new path as well.

Thank you for the fix! One small remark: I think `/site/` paths are meant for plugins, or at least everything not Nvim-core. Wouldn't it be more "correct" to check stdpath('data')/spell before rtp instead?

> Thank you for the fix! One small remark: I think `/site/` paths are meant for plugins, or at least everything not Nvim-core. Wouldn't it be more "correct" to check stdpath('data')/spell before rtp instead?

I thought that we could find the doc right following the runtimepath doc,
```
global
	List of directories to be searched for these runtime files:
	  filetype.lua	filetypes [new-filetype](https://neovim.io/doc/user/filetype.html#new-filetype)
	  autoload/	automatically loaded scripts [autoload-functions](https://neovim.io/doc/user/userfunc.html#autoload-functions)
	  colors/	color scheme files [:colorscheme](https://neovim.io/doc/user/syntax.html#%3Acolorscheme)
	  compiler/	compiler files [:compiler](https://neovim.io/doc/user/quickfix.html#%3Acompiler)
	  doc/		documentation [write-local-help](https://neovim.io/doc/user/usr_41.html#write-local-help)
	  ftplugin/	filetype plugins [write-filetype-plugin](https://neovim.io/doc/user/usr_41.html#write-filetype-plugin)
	  indent/	indent scripts [indent-expression](https://neovim.io/doc/user/indent.html#indent-expression)
	  keymap/	key mapping files [mbyte-keymap](https://neovim.io/doc/user/mbyte.html#mbyte-keymap)
	  lang/		menu translations [:menutrans](https://neovim.io/doc/user/mlang.html#%3Amenutrans)
	  lsp/		LSP client configurations [lsp-config](https://neovim.io/doc/user/lsp.html#lsp-config)
	  lua/		[Lua](https://neovim.io/doc/user/lua.html#Lua) plugins
	  menu.vim	GUI menus [menu.vim](https://neovim.io/doc/user/gui.html#menu.vim)
	  pack/		packages [:packadd](https://neovim.io/doc/user/repeat.html#%3Apackadd)
	  parser/	[treesitter](https://neovim.io/doc/user/treesitter.html#treesitter) syntax parsers
	  plugin/	plugin scripts [write-plugin](https://neovim.io/doc/user/usr_41.html#write-plugin)
	  queries/	[treesitter](https://neovim.io/doc/user/treesitter.html#treesitter) queries
	  rplugin/	[remote-plugin](https://neovim.io/doc/user/remote_plugin.html#remote-plugin) scripts
	  spell/	spell checking files [spell](https://neovim.io/doc/user/spell.html#spell)
	  syntax/	syntax files [mysyntaxfile](https://neovim.io/doc/user/syntax.html#mysyntaxfile)
	  tutor/	tutorial files [:Tutor](https://neovim.io/doc/user/pi_tutor.html#%3ATutor)
```

So I chose to change the default saving path of spell files to `/site/spell`.

On the other hand, I agree with adding the `stdpath('data')/spell` to `runtimepath`, but it could cause a lot of changes.

The `spell_load_lang` finds using `do_in_runtimepath` with `spell/*.add.spl`, so we can't just add the `stdpath('data')/spell` to `runtimepath`.

Or we can add the `stdpath('data')` to `runtimepath`, but it's a change that I can't decide which may cause a lot of side effects.

>  I think /site/ paths are meant for plugins, or at least everything not Nvim-core.

That is true, but we need a (better) place (than `'config'`) to place user data (including in the future tree-sitter parsers). Either we add a new directory for this (which might make sense?) or we move this to `stdpath('state')`.

> That is true, but we need a (better) place (than `'config'`) to place user data (including in the future tree-sitter parsers). Either we add a new directory for this (which might make sense?) or we move this to `stdpath('state')`.

The `stdpath('state')` isn't in the `runtimepath`.

`:h rtp` disagrees.

> 	Defaults are setup to search these locations:

which includes as point 5 `stdpath('state')`. (Probably should be fixed.)

So two options:
1. add a second subdirectory in `stdpath('data')`, e.g. `/core` (placeholder name), to `runtimepath`;
2. change the documentation to mention neovim itself in addition to "user plugins".

@justinmk ?

>  change the documentation to mention neovim itself in addition to "user plugins".

If that (plus the current PR changes) allows us to resolve this, let's do that.

Adding a new dir to rtp sounds like a mess. I'd rather use `stdpath('config')` for spell files than add a new dir to rtp.
It's not just about spell files; I'm also thinking of future downloaded wasm parsers, which we'll have to put in the same location.

~I would definitely consider (custom user-specific) spell files to be data, not state, and think using just `stdpath('data')` for core and `stdpath('data')/site` for plugins makes sense. Option 2 thus seems like the best fit to me.~ EDIT: Sorry, I misunderstood.

> I'm also thinking of future downloaded wasm parsers, which we'll have to put in the same location.

can't they live in site/ ?



> using just `stdpath('data')` for core

? that would require augmenting the default 'runtimepath' ? why is that preferrable to using site/ ?

> can't they live in site/ ?

They can (although nvim-treesitter uses the same directory, so we'll need a different way of handling priority between parsers then); I'm just saying that we are making a decision here that has ramifications beyond just spellfiles.

> using just stdpath('data') for core

That was not my suggestion, and I think would complicate matters a lot more than adding a "sister" directory to `site/` (which I'm mentioning as an option, not something I necessarily advocate over the alternative).

Merged to unblock, but we can change it again later if we decide something better.

If there is a docs change need, please mention it at https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33446



> nvim-treesitter uses the same directory, so we'll need a different way of handling priority between parsers then

hmm
Agreed. It seems that vim would download the missing spell files into srdpath('data')/site/spell. I think  it could be placed here if we can't find a better place.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(spell): save spell files to stdpath('data')/site/spell
